header.#text:
Measures To
			 improve flood protection and climate resilience for New York City

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a study of measures to improve flood
			 protection and climate resilience for New York City, using both traditional
			 engineering and green infrastructure technologies.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—

text.#text: In conducting the study, the

assess traditional
			 engineering solutions, including tide gates and seawalls;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the use of alternative approaches, including oyster reef
			 restoration, tidal wetland restoration and construction, and other natural
			 designs that reduce storm surge impacts and retain storm water while providing
			 additional environmental benefits;

Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric
			 Administration

assess, in
			 consultation with the

, the potential
			 impact of such measures on the surrounding environment, and any adverse impacts
			 of such measures on local housing, commerce, or recreation; and

text.#text:
identify the cost and time associated with

make a recommendation as to which of such
			 measures would provide the greatest protection for New York City coastal
			 communities and critical infrastructure from an event of a magnitude that is
			 equal to or greater than Hurricane Sandy.

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Improvements to
			 port infrastructure and intermodal rail and highway networks

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to make grants to States and local
			 governments for projects to improve port infrastructure and intermodal rail and
			 highway networks.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that local
			 preferences and environmental concerns are incorporated into any port
			 infrastructure and intermodal transportation improvements, so that disruptions
			 and adverse impacts are minimized.

text.#text:
In making grants to States and local
			 governments under this subsection, the

Consideration of
			 local preferences and environmental concerns

text.#text: The

may require.

A

shall establish criteria for awarding

text.#text: The

The
			 criteria shall include an assessment of whether the applicant is able to

to generate
			 economic growth and job creation; or

to improve the
			 environmental sustainability of waterfront areas.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not make grants under this section to a
			 State or local government in an amount that exceeds $10,000,000 in the

an annual report on the achievement of
